item.title: Meadow Folk
item.description: This video cannot be played. The project Meadow Folk is an open-world farming and adventuring game where you save ancient colossi from a spreading corruption. The name “Meadow Folk” is the code name for my team’s 3rd year project. Its production started in September 2017, and it will be ongoing until the end of this school year. It is the longest project I’ve worked on so far, and it also was the biggest team: we started with 30 people, but this steadily grew into 35 over the weeks.

item.title: My main side project: A Path Tracer
item.description: Summary The Path Tracer is a program that I’ve been working on for a long time by now, but very sporadically. In my first year at IGAD, a 3rd year sort of became my mentor, and he showed me what ray and path tracing are, and what you can learn from it. Since then I’ve made several, and I started on this one somewhere around March 2016. It started out as a small project, but I kept adding new things (especially when I started reading the PBR book (the first info source below)).

item.title: AGR: The Fastest Drifter
item.description: This video cannot be played. The project AGR: The Fastest Drifter is an Anti-Gravity Racing game, made with the custom cross-platform (Windows and PS4) Voodoo Engine. Created by a team of 6 programmers at first (the first block of 8 weeks), and 19 people (7 programmers, 12 designers and artists) at the end, it is one of the biggest projects I have worked on so far. In the end, it featured a fully functioning racing game for both single player and local multiplayer, audio, particle effects, several post processing effects on top of the physically based rendering, a complete game-flow with UI and intro cinematics and a suite of tools usable by designers to tweak the game while playing it.
